contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Giovonnie L. Samuels | image = | birth_name = Giovonnie Lavette Samuels | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|11|10}} | birth_place = [[San Diego, California]], USA | occupation = Actress/Voice artist | years_active = 2001—present }} '''Giovonnie Lavette Samuels''' (born November 10, 1985) is an [[United States|American]] actress best known for her role as Nia Moseby in ''[[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]'' and for being a series regular on ''[[All That]]''. ==Life and career== Samuels was born in [[San Diego, California]]. She began appearing on ''[[All That]]'' during 2001, quickly becoming one of the most regularly featured actresses on the show, alongside [[Jamie Lynn Spears]] and others. Samuels also appeared in episodes of ''[[That's So Raven]]'' as Raven's cousin, Betty Jane. She also appeared on ''[[Boston Public]]''. Samuels does voiceover work for [[Bill Cosby]]'s animated show, ''[[Fatherhood (TV series)|Fatherhood]]'', on [[Nick at Nite]]. In [[2006 in film|2006]], she appeared in the movie ''[[Bring It On: All or Nothing]]'', the third ''[[Bring It On (movie)|Bring It On]]'' movie. She has also appeared an as extra in [[Raven-Symoné]]'s "[[Backflip (song)|Backflip]]" video and in the 2007 film ''[[Freedom Writers]]''. In addition, Samuels has appeared in the movie ''Christmas At Water's Edge''. In July 2007, she began appearing as a recurring character on ''[[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]'' as Nia Moseby, niece of [[Marion Moseby]] (Samuels was the replacement of [[Ashley Tisdale]], who was absent due to filming ''[[High School Musical 2]]''). She currently has a recurring role as Camille in the series ''[[Mr. Box Office]]''. ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| border="2" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background: #f9f9f9; border: 1px #aaa solid; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: 90%;" |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! colspan="3" style="background: LightSteelBlue;"|Film |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! align="center"| Year ! width="170"| Film ! width="150"| Role |- | 2007 || ''[[Choices]] || Angela |- | rowspan=2 | 2007 || ''[[Freedom Writers]]''|| Victoria |- | ''[[Bring It On: All or Nothing]]'' || Kirresha<br />(main role) |- | 2006 || ''[[Be the Man]]'' || Alisha |- | 2005 || ''[[Dinner for One]]'' || SiSi |- | 2004 || ''[[Christmas at Water's Edge]]'' || June |- |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! colspan="3" style="background: LightSteelBlue;"|Television |- bgcolor="#CCCCCC" align="center" ! Year |-2012 [[A.N.T FARM]] 11 EPISODE [HER FRIEND SAM] |-2011 -2012 [[THE GAME]] ROLE AS [CARHILE |-2010-2011 [[Suite Life On Deck]] '' [Nia Mosbey 22 | 2007–2008 || ''[[The Suite Life of Zack & Cody]]'' || Nia Moseby<br />(recurring role season 3) |- | 2005 || ''[[That's So Raven]]'' || Betty Jane<br />(special guest character) |- | 2004 || ''[[Fatherhood (TV series)|Fatherhood]]'' || Angie Bindlebeep |- | 2002–2004 || ''[[All That]]'' || Regular Performer<br />(main role) |- | 2001 || ''[[Boston Public]]'' || Macy Talker<br />(guest role) |} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|1123254}} {{Persondata | NAME =Samuels, Giovonnie | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American actor | DATE OF BIRTH =November 10, 1985 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[San Diego, California]], [[United States|U.S.]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Samuels, Giovonnie}} [[Category:1985 births]] [[Category:21st-century American actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from San Diego, California]] [[Category:African-American child actresses]] [[Category:African-American film actresses]] [[Category:African-American television actresses]] [[Category:African-American voice actresses]] [[Category:Living people]] {{US-tv-actor-1980s-stub}}
